info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 1:45PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Fremont, southern Teller and northwestern El Paso Counties through 230 PM MDT... At 144 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Black Forest to Colorado Springs to near Cripple Creek. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Colorado Springs, Fountain, Monument, Air Force Academy, Manitou Springs, Cripple Creek, Victor, Pikes Peak, Black Forest, Peyton, Schriever AFB, Security, Falcon, Security-Widefield, Stratmoor, Gleneagle, Fort Carson, Peterson AFB, Cimarron Hills and Cascade. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
